attributes.action: Calling for an immediate general election
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011 to be repealed so that a general election can be called to take place in the first three months of 2014.

Everyone will have their own reasons for wanting a different Government, but privatisation of the NHS, the bedroom tax, the new £1,200 fee to take bosses to employment tribunal, the looming threat of the proposed Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill (HC Bill 93), cuts to legal aid and the destruction of the social security system are but a few which need to be immediately rectified.
